humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the report, sentinel lymph nodes 1 to 4 from the right axilla were examined and no tumor was found in any of them (0/1, 0/1, 0/1, 0/2). Additionally, no other lymph nodes were identified in the additional axillary tail right breast specimen. Therefore, based on the rules provided, the N stage for this patient is N0, which indicates no metastatic carcinoma in the assessed lymph nodes.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states 'Lymph nodes: Sentinel lymph node only. Lymph node status: Negative 0/5.' This indicates that no cancer was found in the sentinel lymph nodes (SLNs) that were removed and examined. The N stage is determined by the number of involved lymph nodes. In this case, since no lymph nodes contained cancer, the N stage is N0.
